item.title: Working with git submodules
item.description: Adding a new submodule to your git repository: $ git submodule add https://github.com/z0li/hyde.git themes/hyde Initializing the git submodules in a freshly cloned repository: $ git submodule update --init After this your submodules will be in a detached HEAD state. You can pull the latest updates from the remote master with: $ git submodule update --remote And finally, you can commit and push the changes to the main repository: $ git add themes/hyde $ git commit -m "Moved themes/hyde submodule to track the latest commit" $ git push

item.title: How to use grep to highlight matches without filtering out the rest
item.description: Sometimes you want to highlight certain keywords in a file and still see every line, not just the ones that are matching: $ egrep --color 'hello|world|^' <filename>
